utterance.speaker: RABBI
utterance.content: And Ephraim Mankofsky, or simply Mank, as he liked to be called, lived a fruitful life. A proud father of ten beautiful children, Mank was so very, very blessed.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m thinking … ‘Bubblegum Fantasy’ or maybe ‘Frosted Iris’.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I’m thinking ‘Tickle the Toe Red’. It’s my go-to color.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: You expecting someone?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gina got promotional freebies at a new spa and asked us if we wanted to go get manis, pedis, and massages.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you’re going?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: When it comes to your ex-wife, darling, perks outweigh personal considerations. Hello.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Hello. You look great!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, am I invited?

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Uh, no. It’s a girl’s day out. I’m going to spend time with Martha and Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, but I love massages. And I don’t want the three of you conspiring.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Dad. We’ve got a lot of other stuff to talk about.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: I want to hear all about Alexis’ new boyfriend from her point of view. Did you know that they have a song?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a song?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. Taylor Swift’s ‘Mine’. It was playing the first time Ash and I kissed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: La la la … I don’t want to hear that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s why I wanted those tickets so badly. Taylor’s playing an exclusive acoustic show on Tuesday and I wanted to take Ash, but it was sold out before we could get tickets.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, have you checked on eBay? Or your father’s ticket broker?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The only ones available would cost Ash and I six years worth of allowance … each.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Do you remember our song?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: AC/DC’s "You Shook Me All Night Long".

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: La la la … don’t want to hear it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You girls have a great day. Remember, it won’t be the same without me.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Ah, looks like you have plans, anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t we usually get to the victim before the funeral?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we got?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mourners found a body in the casket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that’s unusual, how?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the family was bidding a fond farewell to Mr. Mank here and discovered he wasn’t going to the grave alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it just me or is Mr. Mank smiling?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Our stowaway is Dr. Valerie Monroe, an attending intern at County Hospital.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A doctor? Any connection to the deceased?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan’s talking to the family now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We may know what killed Mr. Mank, but your dead doctor here is more of a mystery. No bullet holes, stab wounds, or ligature marks. She has a perimortem bruise on the back of her neck here, but it wasn’t severe enough to have been fatal. Lividity indicates she died between seven and nine last night, but until I can perform an autopsy, cause of death is unknown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what we do know is that someone was trying to get rid of her body.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Along with her purse and her phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it’s kind of brilliant when you think about it. Disappearing a body in an already occupied coffin. And because Jewish tradition demands you bury the body right away there’s less time to get caught.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If it wasn’t for the pallbearer’s fumble, the good doctor would have disappeared forever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, talk to the funeral director, see if anyone had access to this coffin in the last twenty four hours.

utterance.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I don’t’ know her. I’ve never seen her before and I have no idea how her body got into that casket. This morning when I came in I found one of my back windows smashed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you’re saying somebody broke in here and stashed a body in one of your coffins?

utterance.speaker: FUNERAL DIRECTOR
utterance.content: I called the police but since nothing was missing, you guys didn’t bother showing up. Maybe if you had I wouldn’t have Mrs. Mank out for my blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So according to County Hospital, Dr. Monroe finished her shift at six PM last night, which is about an hour or two before she was murdered, so hopefully her colleagues will be able to tell us where she was headed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop playing with her phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t playing. I wasn’t! The last web searches on her phone were after six PM yesterday. She was looking for a hotel in Katonah, New York. I thought it might be relevant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She also has the new slot car app. So I’m thinking she has friends or family in Katonah. Or, perhaps she was planning a liaison with her lover. Her boyfriend found out and killed her in a jealous rage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, no visible marks on her body other than a small bruise on the back of her neck, that sounds like a jealous rage to me.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Yes. Thank you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you getting mail here now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only when I don’t want my daughter to see it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a Taylor Swift fan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re for Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cost me an arm and a leg, but Alexis will be thrilled. Apparently she and Ash have a song.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we have a song as well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. "You Talk Too Much" by Clarence Carter.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Funeral director’s story checked out. Somebody did break in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get any foreign prints on the casket or the window?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, struck out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But, we might have another at bat. Dr. Monroe’s financials and I found something unusual. Almost every morning she bought coffee.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A doctor who buys coffee. Wow, that is unusual.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It is. If the coffee shop is twenty blocks from her apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it was on her way to work?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nope, complete opposite direction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boyfriend in the neighborhood?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On my way to find out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh great, now he’s mad at me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I found these on the victim’s clothes and hair. Gray nylon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Carpet fibers?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Sent them over to the lab to see if they could determine the manufacturer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, that’s where things get a little interesting. The bruise on her head was made with a blunt object. May have knocked her out but as I suspected, it’s not what killed her. I found a needle mark on the side of her neck. She was injected with a syringe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was poisoned?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not exactly. The killer inserted the needle of an empty syringe into Dr. Monroe’s carotid artery then pushed the plunger, forcing air directly into the brain causing a fatal –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Air embolism.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Gold star for Castle! And judging by the skill of the injection I’d say it was done by a medical professional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like one of her colleagues at County Hospital.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like someone gave her 20ccs of death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, with the state of health care and how stressful this can be for families and for patients, I’m surprised more medical professionals aren’t killed every day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Not to mention the betrayal, the lust, the bed hopping. I’ve watched enough medical dramas to know that doctors are notorious for sleeping with each other. I bet, as we speak, in this hospital, two doctors are in a break room doing it. And by it, I mean –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know what it means, Castle, and that is just a fantasy. Four out of five doctors prefer sleeping with someone outside of their profession.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Four out of five?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How many of them like detectives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One, that I know of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah, you mean Motorcycle Boy is a doctor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Man, Castle. Motorcycle Man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine, but he’s a doctor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh. What kind of doctor? Urologist? Proctologist? Don’t tell me he’s a gynecologist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a cardiac surgeon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Cardiac surgeon. Wow, that’s –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Impressive, yes, it is. In fact, he did an emergency bypass on someone this morning. Saved the patient’s life. What did you do this morning, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Made waffles.

utterance.speaker: JERRY CAMDEN
utterance.content: A patient may be terminal and would suddenly just smile every time Dr. Monroe would walk into a room. It’s a huge, huge loss for us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have any family?

utterance.speaker: CAMDEN
utterance.content: Uh, a brother I think, in San Diego.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: CAMDEN
utterance.content: Not that she ever mentioned. She always said the hospital was her family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there any friction with any of her colleagues?

utterance.speaker: CAMDEN
utterance.content: Well, yesterday, just before the end of her shift, Dr. Monroe had a private meeting with one of our nurses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that unusual?

utterance.speaker: CAMDEN
utterance.content: No, but um, the nurse came out of the meeting looking … shaken. I asked Dr. Monroe about the meeting and she said it was a personal situation that she was looking into and trying to solve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll need to speak with that nurse.

utterance.speaker: CAMDEN
utterance.content: Nurse McClintock. Of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Personal situation with a nurse? Are you thinking what I’m thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hospital love triangle? Check it out. Our dead Dr. Monroe, she’s hot and heavy with her manly McDreamy until she catches him in the on call room with his scrubs around his ankles shagging Naughty Nurse McClintock. Then the inevitable catfight ensues between said nurse and Dr. Monroe. A catfight to the death. Oh, that’s a good title for something. Catfight to the Death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How much TV do you actually watch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Enough to know that this Nurse McClintock will probably be super hot.

utterance.speaker: GREG MCCLINTOCK
utterance.content: Detective? You wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you are?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Nurse McClintock.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Care to revise your theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not what I was expecting but no, I’ll stand by it.

utterance.speaker: LISSA ACKERMAN
utterance.content: Hey Greg.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Hey Dr. Ackerman. So, what can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’re here about Dr. Monroe’s murder.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s pretty awful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We understand you had a meeting with her right before her shift ended last night?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw her. I love the way your hair frames your face. Do you always wear it like that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, for work, yeah, but … so, about Dr. Monroe?

utterance.speaker: IMANI PHELPS
utterance.content: Hi Greg.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Hi Dr. Phelps.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You seem pretty popular around here. Though from what we’ve heard, not so much with Dr. Monroe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you meet with her about last night?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Nothing, really. It’s just that she thought I was too flirty with her female residents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Imagine that.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: What’s wrong with being friendly?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what happened afterwards?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: I walked her to the ambulance dock and promised to keep my distance from her residents. She thanked me and then headed off with some guy I had never seen before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hum. So you walked Dr. Monroe out and then conveniently saw her with some mystery man.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: That’s what happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between seven and nine?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Are you asking for my alibi? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Okay, uh, I was … getting coffee with Imani. I mean, Dr. Phelps. No wait. At that time I was with Rhonda. Dr. Chimes. You can ask her, she’ll verify where I was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dr. Rhonda Chimes, who’s smoking hot, by the way, confirms his story. She went on and on about how Greg is such a great listener and brings her all these cute thinking-of-you gifts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I knew my homicidal hospital love triangle theory had weight. That makes Greg McDreamy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: See, that’s what I thought. But Dr. Chimes says their relationship is strictly platonic. So I spoke to more members of the staff and that’s when I found … the others.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The others?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The other women in what I call ‘The Galaxy of Greg’. Each one of these women orbits Greg and considers him to be their special friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that totally makes him McSteamy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. Spoke with all the planets in the galaxy and none of them are sleeping with him. And CSU did a sweep of the facility. None of their carpet matches the fibers found on the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Makes no sense. Why spend all that time listening to women and buying them things if you’re not going to try to sleep with them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett’s here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe Greg is gay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With the way he was hitting on me? No, he’s so not gay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he’s working an angle or he’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not the only one. Our victim’s student loans. Since graduating med school, Dr. Monroe has been paying minimum amount payments on her four hundred and forty thousand dollar student loan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s how much it costs to become a doctor? Glad I became a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And without any increase in pay at the hospital, six months ago she started paying ten thousand dollars a week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Forty grand a month? Any idea where the money was coming from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not from a bank account. From money orders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So someone was making the payments on her behalf.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just got a fax from hospital security. They got this off the ambulance dock camera. Your boy Greg was telling the truth. Dr. Monroe did head out with another guy. Security showed this photo around but no one recognized him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whoever this man is, he might have been the last one to see Dr. Monroe alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Especially if he killed her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m home and guess what I –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gina got tickets for Taylor Swift! They’re front row center and come with backstage passes! We’re going to meet her!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s great!

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: We just made a deal for her autobiography. It’s no big deal.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ve gotta call Ash. He’s going to be so excited!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe you did that.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got tickets. I mean, you didn’t even call me, to ask me if it was okay?

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: I didn’t imagine that you would disapprove. And Alexis was delighted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that’s not the point.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: No, it’s not. The point is that I was trying to do something nice for Alexis. And apparently all you can see is that I … stole your hero moment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not …

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Any luck on the mystery guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No sir, nothing yet.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Listen, go on home. You can start fresh in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nah…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wouldn’t leave just yet.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Where’ve you been?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Getting coffee.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: All day?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At Dr. Monroe’s coffee shop. Turns out it’s right next to the Faircross Hotel. I showed the manager Dr. Monroe’s picture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pay dirt. Several nights a week our victim was spending the night in a suite belonging to a permanent resident. One Cesar Calderon.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: The drug lord?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: They called him El Diablo. The Devil. You see, Calderon was responsible for half the coke on the streets in the 80s. He was so big no one could touch him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was our saint of a doctor doing spending the night with a drug lord?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Nightly visits? Mystery cash? Gifts? Sounds like Valerie Monroe was the devil’s mistress.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A known criminal living in a swanky hotel. Very Al Capone. A murdered mistress. A brutal Colombian drug lord. What do you think? Revenge from a rival cartel? A drug deal gone wrong? Maybe a murder is simply Calderon’s way of saying ‘I’m just not that into you’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. An air embolism doesn’t exactly strike me as a drug lord’s MO.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless Calderon did that on purpose, to throw suspicion towards the hospital staff on the off chance the body was found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The thing I don’t get is how a respected doctor could literally get into bed with a known drug lord.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, ladies love the bad boys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cesar ‘El Diablo’ Calderon? Ultimate bad boy. I mean, who knows what kind of twisted, depraved, unholy world we’re about to step into.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I’m Detective Kate Beckett. This is Richard Castle. We need to speak with Cesar Calderon.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL CALDERON
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I think you have the wrong room. I don’t know anyone named –

utterance.speaker: CESAR CALDERON
utterance.content: Richard Castle? The Richard Castle? Let them come, Manolo. Let them in.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Welcome. Welcome.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Calderon, I’m Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Pleasure. And you, sir, need no introduction. I am a huge admirer of your fictions. Whenever I desire a taste of my old, grittier life I call upon your works. My favorite is Nikki Fuego.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nikki Fu-? Oh, you mean Nikki Heat.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: No, I mean Nikki Fuego. I only read the Spanish translations. Have you read your novels in Spanish?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Oh, you should. Everything is better in Spanish.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: So. A bestselling novelist and a … gorgeous detective come to pay me a visit. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re investigating a murder.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Ah. How exciting. Who’s the victim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Valerie Monroe.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Valerie Monroe? No. Valerie is dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your relationship with Dr. Monroe?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: She uh… she was my uh … my private physician. I have a bad heart. Six months ago I had a heart attack. My … my brother Manuel took me to the hospital. Valerie was there and … she took care of me. I offered her a position as my concierge physician. Two nights a week my brother is my caretaker, the other five, Valerie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That explains the money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was just your doctor?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: No! She was my … my miracle worker. She gave me back my strength. Valerie forced me back into the world. She made me walk beside her. At night, sometimes we would drive into the park … Whoever did this evil must be punished.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We intend to do just that, Mr. Calderon. Where were you between seven and nine last night?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: I was right here. I ordered room service. The hotel staff can attest to that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The carpet is brown, not gray. She wasn’t killed here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: No. Is he the one that killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All we know is he was with her just before she died.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: I’ve seen this man before. A few times. Valerie had me drop her off at a diner near her place. This man was sometimes waiting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember the name of the diner?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The wait staff said he’s a lunch regular but he hasn’t been in yet today. They don’t know his name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he killed Dr. Monroe and then got out of Dodge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. Let’s just wait here, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Calderon’s alibi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hotel staff confirmed it. How did Alexis’ surprise go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out the surprise was on me. Gina got her tickets, too. Front row, backstage access.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You say that like it’s a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she should have checked with me first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. But at least it means she cared enough to do it, right? There he is. Excuse me, sir. NYPD. We need to ask you a few questions about Dr. Valerie Monroe.

utterance.speaker: LEONARD MALONEY
utterance.content: You want to talk about Valerie? Call my office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you don’t cooperate I’m going to be forced to arrest you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Drop it!

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: No, you drop it. Leonard Maloney, Attorney General’s Office.

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: What the hell’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re investigating the murder of Dr. Monroe.

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: Murder? Valerie’s dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly how did you know her?

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: She was working for me. Undercover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like an Alfred Hitchcock movie. A beautiful professional goes undercover to trap an infamous drug lord.

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: Drug lord?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cesar Calderon. The target of your investigation.

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: Calderon? No, the investigation of Calderon is above my pay grade. Besides, he’s been out of the drug game for years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, what was your target?

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: County Hospital. The state comptroller was investigating the misappropriation of funds, prescription fraud and equipment theft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Medical fraud?

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: Yeah, we couldn’t find the source, so I asked Dr. Monroe to be our eyes and ears on the inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did she find anything?

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: No. And then day before yesterday she calls me out of the blue and wants to meet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By the ambulance dock.

utterance.speaker: MALONEY
utterance.content: When I got there she said she was on to something that involved prescription fraud and a possible smuggling ring. But she didn’t want to point fingers until she had verified things up north this weekend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Up north? The searches on Dr. Monroe’s phone. Katonah, New York.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What does a smuggling ring have to do with Katonah? It’s basically a nothing town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Three reasons why Katonah is awesome. One, gorgeous countrysides. Two, it’s where Doonesbury cartoonist Gary Trudeau went to school. And three, and perhaps most importantly, it’s where Martha Stewart lives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You like Martha Stewart?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t everyone?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah well, I liked her. Till she went to prison for insider trading. Wait a minute. Prison. Next to Katonah is Bedford Hills. And what’s in Bedford Hills, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a women’s prison. Do you think she suspected someone there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we’re talking about a field trip to a woman’s prison, I’m in.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Easy, tiger. Call the prison, have them fax over the visitors' logs from the last six months. And an inmate list. See if anyone there connects to the hospital or our victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, if we’re talking about wading through hospital staff lists and prison logs, I’m out. Besides, I’ve got some amends to make. And it’s gonna take a little bribery.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: Okay Rick, I’m here. What’s so important?

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, nothing says ‘I’m an ass’ like a bunch of helium filled rubber. And you’re not smiling.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: No, it’s just uh … that I had this sick feeling all day. I felt like we had had this fight before and then I remembered the doll debacle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You bought a doll for Alexis, for Christmas.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: And you already had one stashed away in the closet as a surprise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it was a battle deciding which one she would keep.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: And you won, like always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yours was so creepy! Its eyes followed you!

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: This is exactly what I’m talking about, Rick. Even when we were married, you built a wall around Alexis like you didn’t want anyone else to be close to her. When it came to the two of you, I was on the outside, looking in. I just … I don’t want to feel like an outsider anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s growing up. She has a boyfriend now. You wanna know the truth? I feel like an outsider, too. But you’re very right. And I was wrong. And you should be the hero this time.

utterance.speaker: GINA
utterance.content: That’s sweet. You’re sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did it go with amends last night? Did bribery work?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That and sincerity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s always a good combination.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. How goes the haystack? Any needles?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like a pitchfork. There’s no record of Dr. Monroe ever visiting the prison. But, the logs show that another member of the hospital staff was making weekly visits to Bedford Hills prison facility.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyone we know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nurse Greg? Seriously?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously. For the past three years, Greg has been making weekly visits to an inmate named Amy Porter, who is doing thirty years to life for her role as a getaway driver in a failed robbery where a security guard was killed. So I did a little bit of digging and Greg was her character witness at her trial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amy is Greg’s girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Monroe was onto prescription fraud and the smuggling ring. She thought Greg was stealing meds from the hospital and smuggling them in to Amy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For her to distribute on the inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I was right. Greg was working an angle. He was friends with all these women so they would help him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably without them realizing it. So I asked the prison warden to go an search Amy’s cell and then bring her down here for questioning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just got off the phone with the warden from Bedford Hills. Amy Porter suffered a stroke this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At twenty five?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They sent her to County Hospital.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here? Why not bring her to a hospital a little closer to the prison?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: County is the nearest hospital with a secure ward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s also where Greg works.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Phelps? Dr Phelps, we understand that you’re treating a patient named Amy Porter. She’s a prison transfer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greg switched the body. This wasn’t about smuggling something into jail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was about smuggling something out. Oh! Greg pulled a prison break.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A prison break?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir. We swept the hospital but we didn’t find either of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out Greg isn’t McDreamy or McSteamy. He’s McSchemey.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Do we know how he pulled this off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well sir, after reviewing the evidence and with Dr. Parish’s expertise, we think that we figured it out. The key was forging friendships with specific doctors who could provide documents and drugs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why he was just friends and not sleeping with them all. He was committed to Amy the whole time.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Without knowing it, every woman in the Galaxy of Greg helped him with his escape plan. Signatures on death certificates, medical orders, body releases …

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Okay, but how did he fake Amy’s death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Pharmacist Lissa Akerman gave Greg a container of acetyl heptapeptide three. It’s a botox-like topical cream effective in small doses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Akerman thought it was a gift for Greg’s mother, but Greg instead smuggled it into Amy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Amy lathered half her face with it, temporarily diminishing her facial muscles' ability to contract.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Simulating a stroke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then according to prison protocol, Amy was sent to County to receive advanced medical treatment.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And like any good physician, Dr. Phelps immediately ordered an MRI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kicking Greg’s plan into high gear.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Greg used his connections in the ER to get both morphine and meloxin. When he escorted Amy into the MRI, he gave her enough morphine to cause her vital signs to drop to where she had no recordable pulse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Creating the illusion of death. And since Amy had a Do Not Resuscitate order –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, courtesy of Dr. Zha.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was pronounced dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not wanting to waste a second, Greg wheels Amy into the morgue.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And then injects her with the meloxin, bringing her out of the OD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Very Pulp Fiction.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And very dangerous. But effective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greg had the morgue supervisor sign all of the necessary documents to release the body and then placed Jane Doe’s body in Amy’s bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then, like any other couple in love, they walked arm and arm out of the hospital and into the sunrise.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Risking everything for love. If It weren’t for the fact that Dr. Monroe was killed, it’d be a pretty romantic story.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hold on now. I thought Greg had a solid alibi for her murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well sir, we think that an accomplice was helping him out, so we’re looking into known associates and we’ve also got a team out at Greg’s apartment looking to see if they can find any leads. We’re also monitoring his credit cards and we’ve issued APBs for the Tri-S,tate area, but given all of the planning they probably already had an escape route planned. But if we’re lucky we’ll catch a break.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we just did. Greg’s letters to Amy. If they’d been planning this for a long time, there’s gotta be a clue in the letters.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Call the crew over at Greg’s. If we can find Amy’s letters to Greg we’ll have a full set.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are just love notes. There’s nothing in here about the escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then we have to look at these like a romance novel, not a murder mystery. These people are baring their souls in these letters and if we’re lucky we’ll find our Zihuatanejo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In The Shawshank Redemption Andy was trying –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I know what it is. I’m a cop. I’ve seen the movie. It’s just that there’s nothing about that in here. The only thing that Amy talks about is being innocent of the crime she was convicted of and how much she misses Greg.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s pretty clear Greg misses her, too. Listen to this. “The days without you grow longer, but my love for you grows” –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stronger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harder. A poet he’s not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, not everyone is a bestselling crime novelist. And it doesn’t mean that their love was any less. Listen to what she wrote to him. “I can’t bear to see you suffer. Make a new life with someone else. Just be happy. If anyone deserves it, it’s you.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I have his response to that. “I don’t believe in much, but I believe in us.” I like this guy. “And no matter the obstacles, no matter how hard you try, you’ll never get rid of me. I love you.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. These are worthless.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, uh … two lovers reunite after three years. Where would you go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A motel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? That’s what you call special?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … I’m assuming they’re on a budget. All right, where’s the first place you’d go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Someplace romantic. Someplace with special meaning, maybe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like the first place they met? “I’ll never forget the first time I laid eyes on you; that cold rainy night inside the Burgeropolis in Hillsdale.” Hillsdale, New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Burgeropolis? You think that’s their special place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well… that’s … that’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we’ll get lucky with the APBs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, let me know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing from airports, bus or train stations. There’s no credit card activity. Apparently Greg pulled all of his money out of his bank account a week ago. Eight thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s more than enough money to get out of the country. They’re probably halfway to Canada by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we sent their photos to border patrol so if they try to leave we’ll catch them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unless they’re hiding in the trunk of their buddy’s car. Lab ID’d those carpet fibers from Dr. Monroe’s body. They’re from the lining of a car trunk. A DeVille manufactured within the last five years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s probably how the accomplice got the body to the funeral home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, check into surveillance cameras within the vicinity of the funeral home. Maybe we’ll get lucky, get a license plate, and track down that accomplice.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Or you could just ask Greg who his accomplice is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Those Jersey state troopers you had staking out the Burgeropolis just pulled your fugitive lovebirds from the drive through. They’re bringing them in now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You had Jersey state troopers stake out the Burgeropolis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you said that was stupid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you said it was stupid. And it looks like you were wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, no. I was right!

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: I love her. What was I supposed to do? Leave her in that prison to rot? What would you have done? The love of your life, behind bars, for a crime she didn’t commit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not what this is about, Mr. McClintock.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: Yes, it is. Amy didn’t drive the getaway car in that robbery. Her car was stolen. She got screwed –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, focus Greg. We’re not interested in your girlfriend’s crimes. We’re here because of Dr. Monroe’s murder.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: What? I have an alibi, remember?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you have an alibi. We also know you have an accomplice.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: I don’t have an accomplice. I don’t know anything about her murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. And Dr. Monroe really pulled you into that meeting to scold you for flirting with her residents. She was on to you. She knew about the drugs, she knew about the plan. She knew about Bedford Hills and that’s why you had her killed.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: No! When she pulled me into her office, I knew she was on to me. I had to move fast before she ruined everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you killed her.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: No! I didn’t kill – All I did was change the date of Amy’s escape. I had to get her out before Dr. Monroe found out everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe she already knew everything. Maybe she threatened to turn you in.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: No. From her questions, I could tell, she was fishing. Trying to put the pieces together. She was off shift for the next two days, so I figured if I could distract her and get the hell out of her office, our plan might still have a chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean you distracted her?

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: You know, change the subject. I started asking her about this new bracelet she had. How it was a special gift from her boyfriend. Then, a few minutes later, her phone rang and I got the hell out of there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s a pretty good story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only, Dr. Monroe didn’t have a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: No, I swear. The way she was talking about that bracelet, she definitely had a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In this whole investigation there has not been one mention of a boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably because she was lying. Look - Nothing, nothing, nothing. See? No bracelet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A nearby bank cam caught a photo of a DeVille heading towards the direction of our funeral home shortly after our window for time of death. It was the only one that passed by that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, is there a better angle so we can see the license plate or the driver?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope, that’s the best one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, look. He wasn’t lying. She was wearing a bracelet right before she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well where did it go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU didn’t find one in the coffin or anywhere else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer took it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why? I mean, it doesn’t look like it was worth very much. And if it was about money, why didn’t he take her purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it wasn’t about money. It was about passion. Do you recognize that bracelet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve seen that design before.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Detective. Mr. Castle. Have you made any progress finding Valerie’s killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe we have. Tell me, what was the exact nature of your relationship with Dr. Monroe?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: I told you already. She was my physician.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said that before, but I’m confused. You see, unlike you, I don’t take long, romantic drives with my doctor. I do that with my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: We don’t yet live in a world where passion is a crime, do we Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but crimes of passion are. Especially murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a lovely necklace you’re wearing, Mr. Calderon. May I? I couldn’t help but notice there’s a similar design to the bracelet that Valerie was wearing the night she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: That’s because I gave it to her as a token of my affection. It belonged to my mother. This belonged to my father. They’re a set.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, considering it’s an heirloom, no wonder you wanted it back.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: I don’t know what you mean.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It wasn’t on her body when she was found. Someone removed it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened? Did she reject you? Is that when the old Calderon returned? Not the cognac swirling, renaissance man we see before us but the ruthless killer?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Be careful Mr. Castle. This is not one of your fictions where people bleed ink. I loved her, yes, but I did not kill her. I was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you’re wealthy enough to have bought that alibi.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: This is outrageous. I will not be slandered –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is not slander if there is proof. This is a photo from an ATM camera, the night that she was killed, about a block and a half away from the funeral home where her body was dumped.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s your car, Mr. Calderon. The same one you and Valerie used to take your long romantic drives.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: No, you’re mistaken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Save it, Calderon. We found nylon fibers on her body. Gray, just like the color of your carpet on the back of your DeVille. So what was her body doing stuffed in the trunk of your car?

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: I was here. I … I remember the … I was here. But you… you took the keys that night. It was you. I can see it in your eyes. Manolo, it was you.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: You don’t understand, hermano, I had to. I had to. I did it for you.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: She was an informant. When I saw her with that man at the diner, I followed him. And you know what I found? He worked for the Attorney General. She betrayed you!

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: Why didn’t you come to me?

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: Because you were too blind, brother. And when you gave her mother’s bracelet I knew it was up to me to keep Valerie from hurting you.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: What did you do, Manolo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He hit her in the head. Knocked her out. And then using the syringe skills he developed caring for you, he injected her with air.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Leaving no blood evidence. And then he stuffed her body into somebody else’s coffin so you would never know.

utterance.speaker: CALDERON
utterance.content: How could you do this?

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: I made them disappear. Just like you taught me, hermano. No body, no murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manuel Calderon, you’re under arrest for the murder of Dr. Valerie Monroe.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: I couldn’t let them hurt you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The fact is, she wasn’t going to. She wasn’t investigating your brother. She was looking into corruption at County Hospital.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You killed her for nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know that Nurse Greg fellow? He impresses me. You know, someone willing to risk it all to break his lover out of the big house? Ah… we should all have that in our lives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, we should.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, you’re home! How was it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Taylor was amazing. Ash and I held hands while she sang our song. It was so great. Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s okay. Gina told me. The tickets were from both of you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Very considerate of Gina.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it was, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re starting to like her, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I stopped being emotionally invested in your girlfriends after you dumped that darling Lizzie in the eleventh grade. Gina’s very nice. A little over the top, but you know. You’re happy, I’m happy. But, the question is this. When it comes down to it, would you be willing to break her out of prison? Because that, my boy, is true love.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Oh God, I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: GREG
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: I can’t stand the thought of you getting locked up over me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you might not have to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After hearing all your claims of innocence we decided to go over your arrest file. Turns out, there were a lot of discrepancies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we sent the files over to Leonard Maloney over at the Attorney General’s office and he agreed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently your public defender was a real hack. He overlooked several key pieces of evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Including a statement that was ignored because of the eyewitness’s mental illness, so Maloney has agreed to reopen your case, and he believes you have cause to be hopeful.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: What about Greg?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in the spirit of justice, Maloney has said that if you get exonerated he will recommend that Greg get probation.

utterance.speaker: AMY
utterance.content: Why are you doing all this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because someone convinced me that a love story as good as yours deserves a shot at a happy ending.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, um. We feel bad that the state troopers picked you up at Burgeropolis before you could re-live your first date. So until you do get out … … we brought you this. I told them to hold the onions.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That was a nice thing you did in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, I just thought that after everything Greg did for her they deserved a chance. Besides, if it were you and I in Amy’s shoes, we’d still be rotting in prison.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speak for yourself, bro. I’d escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, you’d just leave me in there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s law of the jungle. I gotta look out for numero uno.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Nothing like a hypothetical prison term to let you know who your friends really are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Castle. I’d get you out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
